NotStarted.title: Reset Controller to Factory Settings
NotStarted.body: If you decide to move forward, you will reset your controller to factory settings. As a result, the controller will forget all devices it is paired with and all Z-Wave devices for this network will be removed from NDX IoT Platform. If there are any devices still paired with the controller when it is reset, they will have to go through the exclusion process before they can be re-paired. Would you like to continue?

InProgress.title: Resetting Controller
InProgress.body: Your controller is being reset and restarted. Wait until the process is complete before closing this dialog

Done.title: Controller Reset Complete
Done.body: Your controller has been reset to factory settings and has been restarted! You can now close this dialog.

hard_reset_controller.confirmation: This action cannot be undone unless you have an NVM backup from your controller.

remove_node.title: Remove a Z-Wave device
remove_node.introduction: Remove a device from your Z-Wave network, and remove the associated device and entities from NDX IoT Platform.

rebuild_network_routes.title: Rebuild routes for your Z-Wave network
rebuild_network_routes.introduction: Start rebuilding routes on your Z-Wave network. Rebuilding routes will cause all devices to re-calculate their routes back to the controller and is recommended if you have recently moved devices or your controller.
rebuild_network_routes.traffic_warning: The rebuilding process generates a large amount of traffic on the Z-Wave network. This may cause devices to respond slowly (or not at all) while the rebuild is in progress.
rebuild_network_routes.in_progress: Rebuild of network routes is in progress. This will take some time.
rebuild_network_routes.run_in_background: You can close this dialog and the rebuild of network routes will continue in the background.
rebuild_network_routes.rebuilding_routes_failed: Route rebuilding failed. Additional information may be available in the logs.
rebuild_network_routes.rebuilding_routes_cancelled: Rebuilding network routes has been cancelled.

rebuild_node_routes.title: Rebuild routes for a Z-Wave device
rebuild_node_routes.introduction: Tell {device} to update its routes back to the controller. This can help with communication issues if you have recently moved the device or your controller.
rebuild_node_routes.traffic_warning: The route rebuilding process generates a large amount of traffic on the Z-Wave network. This may cause devices to respond slowly (or not at all) while the rebuilding is in progress.

rebuild_node_routes.routes_rebuild_in_progress: A Z-Wave routes rebuild is already in progress. Please wait for it to finish before rebuilding routes for an individual device.

update_firmware.title: Update device firmware
update_firmware.warning: WARNING: Firmware updates can brick your device if you do not correctly follow the manufacturer's guidance. The NDX IoT Platform and Z-Wave JS teams do not take any responsibility for any damages to your device as a result of the firmware update and will not be able to help you if you brick your device. Would you still like to continue?
update_firmware.warning_controller: WARNING: Firmware updates can brick your controller if you do not use the right firmware files, or if you attempt to stop the firmware update before it completes. The NDX IoT Platform and Z-Wave JS teams do not take any responsibility for any damages to your controller as a result of the firmware update and will not be able to help you if you brick your controller. Would you still like to continue?
update_firmware.introduction: Select the firmware file you would like to use to update {device}.
update_firmware.introduction_controller: Select the firmware file you would like to use to update {device}. Note that once you start a firmware update, you MUST wait for the update to complete.
update_firmware.firmware_target_intro: Select the firmware target (0 for the Z-Wave chip, ≥1 for other chips if they exist) for this update.
update_firmware.queued: The firmware update is ready to be sent to {device} but the device is asleep, wake the device to start the update.
update_firmware.close_queued: If you close this dialog, the update will continue to be queued in the background and start automatically once the device wakes up.
update_firmware.awake: The firmware update should start being sent to {device} shortly.
update_firmware.close: If you close this dialog, the update will continue in the background.
update_firmware.in_progress: The firmware update on {device} is in progress ({progress}%).
update_firmware.confirm_abort: Are you sure you want to abort the firmware update on {device}?

finished_status.try_again: To attempt the firmware update again, select the new firmware file you would like to use.
finished_status.done: The firmware update is complete! If you want to attempt another firmware update on this device, please wait until it gets re-interviewed.
finished_status.done_controller: The firmware update is complete! Your controller is being restarted and your network will temporarily be unavailable.

protection_mode.title: Protection mode is disabled!
protection_mode.content: Protection mode on this add-on is disabled! This gives the add-on full access to the entire system, which adds security risks, and could damage your system when used incorrectly. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

stage.title: Add-on Stage
stage.description:
Add-ons can have one of three stages:

{icon_stable} **Stable**: These are add-ons ready to be used in production.

{icon_experimental} **Experimental**: These may contain bugs, and may be unfinished.

{icon_deprecated} **Deprecated**: These add-ons will no longer receive any updates.

rating.title: Add-on security rating
rating.description:
NDX IoT Platform provides a security rating to each of the add-ons, which indicates the risks involved when using this add-on. The more access an add-on requires on your system, the lower the score, thus raising the possible security risks.

A score is on a scale from 1 to 8. Where 1 is the lowest score (considered the most insecure and highest risk) and a score of 8 is the highest score (considered the most secure and lowest risk).

host_network.title: Host network
host_network.description: Add-ons usually run in their own isolated network layer, which prevents them from accessing the network of the host operating system. In some cases, this network isolation can limit add-ons in providing their services and therefore, the isolation can be lifted by the add-on author, giving the add-on full access to the network capabilities of the host machine. This gives the add-on more networking capabilities but lowers the security, hence, the security rating of the add-on will be lowered when this option is used by the add-on.

homeassistant_api.title: NDX IoT Platform API access
homeassistant_api.description: This add-on is allowed to access your running NDX IoT Platform instance directly via the NDX IoT Platform API. This mode handles authentication for the add-on as well, which enables an add-on to interact with NDX IoT Platform without the need for additional authentication tokens.

full_access.title: Full Hardware access
full_access.description:
This add-on is given full access to the hardware of your system, by request of the add-on author. Access is comparable to the privileged mode in Docker. Since this opens up possible security risks, this feature impacts the add-on security score negatively.

This level of access is not granted automatically and needs to be confirmed by you. To do this, you need to disable the protection mode on the add-on manually. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

hassio_api.title: Supervisor API access
hassio_api.description: The add-on was given access to the Supervisor API, by request of the add-on author. By default, the add-on can access general version information of your system. When the add-on requests 'manager' or 'admin' level access to the API, it will gain access to control multiple parts of your NDX IoT Platform system. This permission is indicated by this badge and will impact the security score of the add-on negatively.

docker_api.title: Full Docker access
docker_api.description:
The add-on author has requested the add-on to have management access to the Docker instance running on your system. This mode gives the add-on full access and control to your entire NDX IoT Platform system, which adds security risks, and could damage your system when misused. Therefore, this feature impacts the add-on security score negatively.

This level of access is not granted automatically and needs to be confirmed by you. To do this, you need to disable the protection mode on the add-on manually. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

host_pid.title: Host processes namespace
host_pid.description:
Usually, the processes the add-on runs, are isolated from all other system processes. The add-on author has requested the add-on to have access to the system processes running on the host system instance, and allow the add-on to spawn processes on the host system as well. This mode gives the add-on full access and control to your entire NDX IoT Platform system, which adds security risks, and could damage your system when misused. Therefore, this feature impacts the add-on security score negatively.

This level of access is not granted automatically and needs to be confirmed by you. To do this, you need to disable the protection mode on the add-on manually. Only disable the protection mode if you know, need AND trust the source of this add-on.

apparmor.title: AppArmor
apparmor.description:
AppArmor ('Application Armor') is a Linux kernel security module that restricts add-ons capabilities like network access, raw socket access, and permission to read, write, or execute specific files.

Add-on authors can provide their security profiles, optimized for the add-on, or request it to be disabled. If AppArmor is disabled, it will raise security risks and therefore, has a negative impact on the security score of the add-on.

auth_api.title: NDX IoT Platform authentication
auth_api.description: An add-on can authenticate users against NDX IoT Platform, allowing add-ons to give users the possibility to log into applications running inside add-ons, using their NDX IoT Platform username/password. This badge indicates if the add-on author requests this capability.
